auditorium

Interface IAuditoriumLayer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AAuditoriumLayer, AuditoriumIntegrityLayer, AuditoriumTemporalLayer

    public interface IAuditoriumLayer
    Layers: In an auditorium implementation, each layer is a stage which a message must go through both when it is sent by a host and received by a host. In code, each layer implementation must implement this interface.

    Method Calls:As should be obvious, each layer should decorate the behavior of each of the methods in this interface of the layer below it. The "links" between layers in an auditorium stack are these method calls. Layers that are higher in the stack (closer to the application) must override methods in this interface such that the behavior for the particular layer is executed either before or after the decorated method call is made. This means that for each method, information either flows from lower layers to higher layers, or from higher layers to lower layers (which dictates whether the decorated method call is made before or after the decorating behavior). This is specified explicitly in the comments for each method. Because each layer has something to contribute both to return values and parameters, return values and parameters are also constructed in a layered manner using s-expressions.

    When constructing a parameter to pass to a lower layer, do it in the following way:
    ([action name] [parameter] [previous layer's payload)
    When constructing a return value, expect your parameter to come in this form as well.

    • Method Detail

      • makeJoin

        ASExpression makeJoin(ASExpression datum)
        Make the datum to be sent as part of a join message. Flow: top to bottom.
        Parameters:
        datum - Place this datum in the message.
        Returns:
        The datum to be dropped in the join message.

      • makeJoinReply

        ASExpression makeJoinReply(ASExpression joinmessage)
        Make the datum for a join reply message. Flow: top to bottom.
        Parameters:
        joinmessage - This is the datum from the join message that was received.
        Returns:
        This method returns the join reply datum.

      • makeAnnouncement

        ASExpression makeAnnouncement(ASExpression announcement)
        Make the datum for an announcement message. Flow: top to bottom.
        Parameters:
        announcement - Send this announcement.
        Returns:
        This method returns the announcement datum.

      • receiveAnnouncement

        ASExpression receiveAnnouncement(ASExpression datum)
                                 throws IncorrectFormatException
        Process an announcement that was received on the network. Flow: bottom to top.
        Parameters:
        datum - Process this datum.
        Returns:
        This method returns the remaining data after it is unwrapped.
        Throws:
        IncorrectFormatException - This method throws if the datum is not formatted how it needs to be for a given layer to use it correctly.

      • receiveJoin

        ASExpression receiveJoin(ASExpression datum)
                         throws IncorrectFormatException
        Process a join message that was received on the network. Flow: bottom to top.
        Parameters:
        datum - Process this datum.
        Returns:
        After a layer processes the piece of the datum it needs, it returns the rest.
        Throws:
        IncorrectFormatException - This method throws if the datum is not formatted how it needs to be for a given layer to use it correctly.

        Returns:
        After a layer processes the piece of the datum it needs, it returns the rest.
        Throws:
